entry.citation: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) 2010 Global Forest Resources Assessment,
entry.comments: Between 1976/78 and 1993/95, the area occupied by natural forests (i.e. forest, excluding plantations) and shrub/grass land decreased from 23, 4,298,100 ha (25.7% of the country) to 15,097,900 ha (16.6%) according to FORMECU (1998a). The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) 2010 Global Forest Resources Assessment states that Nigeria's rate of deforestation is -3.7 percent or 410,000 ha per year for 2000-2010. The report is available at http://www.fao.org/forestry/fra/fra2010/en/. The figures displayed for 2000-2010 are not identical annual data points--they instead reflect an average of 4100 km2/year for the period 2000-2010. We do not at this time have annual data points.
